reviews.review_msg: Interesting course, prof not good at teaching. Be prepared to learn everything by researching online. Tough works, heavy duties

He is a nice person but as a teacher he is far from great. I am not convinced that he really understands some of the algorithms he teaches; otherwise he would be much more confident answering questions. His assignments are not clearly explained, sometimes even confusing.
VERY CARING AND NICE. SUPER INTELLIGENT. He even taught us some Algorithms he developed 21 years ago.

My only complaint is about the quiz because sometimes it's ambiguous. Professor did say he spent hours to find appropriate questions, so I think he still cares about our experience. I didn't have unpleasant experience myself. If you learn by reading, you have an easy time; If you rely on listening or doing project, maybe its harder but still OK.

Many a times, you attend classes not just for grades but for experiences. Ke Wang just makes sure you get the WORST possible experience. Just talk to him for 5 mins, you'll start getting that experience. Nightmarish guy!! 
I don't know how is still a instructor? I won't  even hire him to teach a 10 year old son.

While the teaching practice is not perfect, I think this course is not demanding or frustrating. As long as you understand the materials on the slides and did what is required, you can expect to get a fairly good grade. The assignments are not heavy and the materials are not too intellectually challenging. I had a good learning experience.

I expected more learning material and a project. I hope that we had channels like piazza to ask questions and receive feedback. But I really can't complain too much. The assignments are graded timely. The workload is not too heavy. We learned a decent amount of knowledge. Overall it's good. There's curving, which is not meant to give you low marks.

He would spend time in class to clarify the answers to quizzes and exams. While this is not the best practice (it 's like TA's job), I still feel that the professor want everyone to have a good learning experience without confusion. While there're minor complaints, I believe he's a good professor. No accent or logistic problem from my experience.
Doesn't know how to teach. Very bad Communication skills. Won't take the students feedback. Avoid!!!
It is unbelievable that someone like him was actually allowed to teach. Whoever helped this man get hired here should be banned from academia for life. That's how bad Ke Wang is!

No empathy at all and ridiculous. Told him I enrolled late because I'm from other department and have to get approval from Grad Studies to enroll. It took the staff 1 month to enroll me due to inactivities. So I missed one assignment ddl, which is 20%. But he wouldn't give extension for that. Notes basically from web, can't believe paid 2K for that

I liked his notes. Powerpoints which may have been copied from somewhere else, but they were good, straightforward explanations that were sufficient for me to understand almost all of the concepts covered. Seemed brusque and standoffish at first, but eventually showed a sense of humour and was helpful during office hours. Good, fair exam.

Awful prof, doesn't put in any time to prepare for lectures, all his slides are plagiarised from online, end class project worth 30% of grade was not part of the class curriculum (clearly chosen by TA and related to his research not relevant to class)

He made up rules as the course went along. Said the exam would be open book, then 2 days before changed it to closed book. Moved class times without asking what works. Told us we were being marked for participation at the end of the course without ever telling us before.  One of my worst profs ever. The marker also didn't understand the material.
